articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets New German Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets New German Ambassador
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Gerhard Thiedemann, new Ambassador of the Federal Republic of Germany to the DPRK, Tuesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held
articles.content:
National Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held
Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A national seminar took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday to grasp the undying feats performed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Song Ja Rip, president of Kim Il Sung University and concurrently minister of Higher Education, and others.
					
					 The seminar heard five papers explaining in detail the feats Kim Jong Il performed in building a thriving socialist nation by leading the general offensive for improving the people's standard of living through his forced march for field guidance last year.
					
					 The speakers referred to the great leadership of Kim Jong Il who developed the WPK into an eternal party of President Kim Il Sung and into a promising invincible party and brought epoch-making changes to this land through his indefatigable forced march for field guidance.
					
					 They also explained the fact that he built a strong mainstay of a thriving nation by giving full play to the mental power of all servicepersons and people and leading a dynamic drive for Juche-orientation and performed immortal exploits in the development of Korean culture and arts.
					
					 They underlined the need for all the officials and working people to deeply grasp the feats Kim Jong Il has performed before the country and the revolution and wage a more dynamic general offensive to bring about a decisive turn in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the WPK.

articles.title: Sports Contest for Paektusan Prize Opens
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Paektusan Prize Opens
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A sports contest for Paektusan Prize opened in the DPRK on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					 The participants will compete in 10 events like basketball, volleyball, table tennis, handball, shooting, ice hockey and skiing in Pyongyang, Samjiyon in Ryanggang Province and other places.
					
					 Its opening ceremony was held at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium Tuesday.
					
					 Present were Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and officials concerned.
					
					 Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Pak Myong Chol made an opening address.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Its Wild Ambition for Reinvasion
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Its Wild Ambition for Reinvasion 
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Japan "Self-Defense Forces" have staged ceaseless military exercises since the outset of the year while stepping up the modernization of arms and equipment in real earnest. These disturbing moves come under fire by a bylined commentary of DPRK major paper Rodong Sinmun Tuesday.
					 This saber-rattling indicates that the Japanese reactionaries are frantically pushing forward the moves for reinvasion at a very grave phase.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Japan is stepping up the preparations for reinvasion of Korea and other parts of Asia and working hard to move up the time for its launch.
					
					 Japan's claim that its military exercises are aimed to "cope with a missile strike" from someone and "defend a remote island" is just rhetoric to cover up its militarist scenario for reinvasion and its conversion into a military giant and rush headlong into a military adventure.
					
					 This is clearly evidenced by Japan's increased zeal shown for having modern arms and equipment in place.
					
					 The SDF is busy with the exercises for "evacuating Japanese overseas" and its landing drills outside the country. These moves are prompted by the Japanese reactionaries' scenario to round up their preparations for reinvasion to ignite a war any time.
					
					 They are, however, anachronistic and reckless ones. The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to face up to the present changed reality, cool their heads heated with the militarist ambition and behave with reason.

articles.title: Koreans Should Pool Efforts for Reunification--Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Koreans Should Pool Efforts for Reunification--Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A bright prospect for peace, reunification and prosperity will open if Koreans from all walks of life in the north and the south and abroad struggle in unity with patriotism, said Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a bylined article.
					 Whoever truly loves the country and the nation can never overlook the tragic division of the country forced by foreign forces and ensuing misfortune and pain, the article said, adding:
					
					 For the Koreans patriotism lies in devoting their all to the worthwhile struggle for country's peace and reunification, not in making spurious rhetoric.
					
					 The Korean nation can be likened to an organism which can not live divided. Reunification only would help them pave the way for carving out the nation's destiny.
					
					 The dynamic trend of the times toward independent reunification, peace and prosperity calls on all political parties, organizations and people in the north and the south and abroad to closely unite for the important work of the nation and subordinate everything to the cause of reunification irrespective of ism and partisan interests and strategy.
					
					 Unity of pro-reunification patriotic forces provides the might for smashing the challenge of anti-reunification forces. Unity is a key factor decisive of success or failure of the national reunification movement. This truth has already been proved by the history of the reunification movement that has lasted over six decades.

articles.title: Koreans in US Call for Contributing to Prosperity of Nation
articles.content:
Koreans in US Call for Contributing to Prosperity of Nation
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. at a general meeting held in the U.S. from Jan. 28 to 30 adopted an action program for this year.
					 The participants reflected in the program the issues of contributing to the prosperity of the nation through actions for the normalization of the DPRK-U.S. relations, the mending of the north-south relations, etc.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of expanding and strengthening the organization and adopted a resolution on implementing the contents of the program.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised Abroad
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups with portrait and photo of General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birthday.
					 A magazine of Hong Kong, China, carried articles under various titles including "Birthday of Leader Kim Jong Il" and "Songun Iron Foundry" in its February issue.
					
					 An article titled "Son of people" said that Kim Jong Il has always respected the people saying if there be an almighty being in the world it is the people.
					
					 He has devoted his all to the popular masses, always regarding them as his great teacher, the article added. 
					
					 Unidad Nacional, a Mexican newspaper, devoted a whole page to an article titled "Leader of the Workers' Party of Korea" in its January 31st issue.
					
					 The article said that the WPK could have developed into the ever-victorious and iron-willed party and an invincible one commanding absolute support and trust from the people as it is led by Kim Jong Il. It introduced his party leadership exploits in detail.

articles.title: Birthday of Kim Jong Il Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Birthday of Kim Jong Il Celebrated Abroad 
 Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibitions were held in Bulgaria, Russia and Nigeria from Jan. 26 to Feb. 2 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Visitors looked round works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos showing their undying feats and books, photos and handicrafts introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 The curator of the Sophia City Library in Bulgaria said that the exhibition offered Bulgarians an opportunity to know better about the achievements made by the Korean people in the political, economic, cultural and various other fields.
					
					 This exhibition will contribute to promoting friendship between the two peoples and boosting the exchange, cooperation and ties in the field of culture, he added.
					
					 The department director of the Art and Cultural Council of the Ministry of Federal Capital Territory of Nigeria wished the Korean people fresh successes in their struggle to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and achieve national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Ecuador
Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was published on e-book by the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People on Jan. 30.
					 The work, published on April 18, Juche 87 (1998), clarifies the five-point policy of the great national unity which serves as important guidelines for achieving the great unity of the whole nation.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- It was one day in April, Juche 78 (1989) that President Kim Il Sung visited the lodging quarters where Rev. Mun Ik Hwan of south Korea was put up during his visit to Pyongyang.
					 The President sat face to face with Mun quite informally and heard his impressions of the north while having a talk with him. The President said with a firm resolve that the U.S. troops should be forced to quit south Korea and the country be reunified by the concerted efforts of the Koreans without fail and that Korea can never be reunified with the backing of a big country.
					
					 He added that he fully approved of whatever necessary for the reunification of the country and he had no idea of considering the work for national reunification as a delicate matter.
					
					 Walking the balcony of the lodging quarters with Mun arm in arm before parting with each other, the President stressed the need to reunify the country as soon as possible and hand the reunified country to posterity now that the old generation is replaced by a new one and the appearance of the mountains and rivers changes.
					
					 Fascinated by the President's extraordinary personality as a great man, broad-minded magnanimity, noble virtues and ardent love for the country and the nation, Rev. Mun looked up to him in reverence, overcome with emotion.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il se reune con nuevo embajador aleman
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il se reune con nuevo embajador aleman
Pyongyang, 8 de febrero (ATCC) -- Kim Yong Il, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, converso el dia 8 con Gerhard Thiedemann, nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Federal de Alemania en Corea, quien le realizo una visita de cortesia.

articles.title: Tiene lugar simposio central de las hazanas de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tiene lugar simposio central de las hazanas de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 8 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 8 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el simposio central para estudiar profundamente las inmortales hazanas del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					En la ocasion participaron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el presidente del Comite de Educacion Kim Yong Jin, el rector general de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y ministro de Educacion Superior, Song Ja Rip, y otros.
					
					Fueron publicadas 5 disertaciones que han explicado las hazanas del Dirigente Kim Jong Il realizadas ante la causa de construccion de la gran potencia prospera socialista al dirigir el ano pasado a manera de marcha forzada muchas unidades poniendose en la delantera de la ofensiva general para el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Los seminaristas destacaron que el Dirigente convirtio el PTC en el partido eterno del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el invencible y prometedor y trajo en el territorio patrio los cambios seculares mediante su incansable guia en el terreno.
					
					El Dirigente levanto los pilares de la gran potencia prospera movilizando el poderio espiritual de todos los militares y civiles y sentando la base de desarrollo economico con recursos y tecnologias nacionales y realizo imborrables proezas para el desarrollo cultural y artistico de Corea, enfatizaron.
					
					Todos los funcionarios y trabajadores deben asimilar profundamente las hazanas del Dirigente Kim Jong Il realizadas por la patria y la revolucion y desplegar con mas coraje la ofensiva general para registrar un viraje decisivo en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construccion de la gran potencia prospera bajo la direccion del PTC, concluyeron.

articles.title: Inaugurada competencia deportiva por la Copa Paektusan
articles.content:
Inaugurada competencia deportiva por la Copa Paektusan
Pyongyang, 8 de febrero (ATCC) -- Con motivo del cumpleanos (el 16 de febrero) del Dirigente        Kim Jong Il, quedo inaugurada el dia 8 en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la Competencia Deportiva por la Copa Paektusan.
					Durante el evento, tendran lugar en Pyongyang, Samjiyon de la provincia de Ryanggang y otros lugares los juegos de 10 disciplinas, incluyendo baloncesto, voleibol, ping pong, balomano, tiro, jockey y esqui.
					
					En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Nung Su y otros funcionarios.
					
					El discurso de la ocasion estuvo a cargo del ministro de Deportes, Pak Myong Chol.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta sospechosos movimientos militares de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta sospechosos movimientos militares de Japon
  Pyongyang, 8 de febrero (ATCC) -- Desde el principio del ano en curso, Japon desarrolla sucesivamente los ejercicios militares y acelera en etapa crucial la modernizacion de armamentos.
					Con respecto a esos sospechosos movimientos, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico en su edicion del dia 8 un comentario individual.
					
					  Las sucesivas maniobras militares de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" evidencian que entran en la etapa muy grave las pretensiones de los reaccionaros japoneses de relanzar cuanto antes la agresion contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el continente asiatico, senala el articulo y prosigue:
					
					  Los pretextos utilizados por ellos como "hacer frente al ataque de misiles" de alguien y la "defensa de la isla apartada" no pasan de ser una cortina de humo para encubrir su intencion militarista de agredir de nuevo y sus acciones encaminadas a convertir su pais en una potencia militar. 
					
					  En el mismo contexto, se mueven con fanatismo para tener los pertrechos militares ultramodernos. 
					
					  Por otra parte, las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" libran el "ejercicio de transporte de japoneses residentes en ultramar" y el otro de desembarco en el extranjero partiendo de su ambicion de desatar la guerra en cualquier momento tras ultimar los preparativos para la nueva agresion.
					
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses deben ver bien la realidad cambiada de hoy y actuar con prudencia dandose clara cuenta de que son anacronicos sus movimientos militaristas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun reclama fuerzas unidas de la nacion coreana
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun reclama fuerzas unidas de la nacion coreana
Pyongyang, 8 de febrero (ATCC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este martes, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que si los habitantes de diferentes sectores y capas del Norte y el Sur de Corea y en ultramar luchan uniendo sus fuerzas y almas patrioticas, se abrira sin falta un horizonte amplio y prometedor en la lucha por la paz, la reunificacion y la prosperidad.
					Quienes aman de veras el pais y la nacion, no deben hacer vista gorda de la division del pais impuesta por las fuerzas foraneas y de las desgracias y sufrimientos causados por ella, comienza el articulista y continua:
					
					El patriotismo para la nacion coreana, que sufre esa tragedia, no esta en algunas palabras elegantes sino en dedicar todo lo suyo a la lucha valiosa por la paz del pais y la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Para la nacion coreana igual a un organismo que no puede vivir separado en dos partes, la verdadera via para forjar el destino nacional esta en la reunificacion.
					
					La impetuosa corriente de la epoca de hoy hacia la reunificacion independiente, la paz y la prosperidad demanda que todos los partidos politicos, entidades y habitantes de distintos sectores del Norte, el Sur y en ultramar se unan firmemente colocando en la cima la gran empresa nacional superando las diferencias de doctrinas, intereses y criterios fraccionalistas y sujeten lo todo al cumplimiento de la causa de reunificacion.
					
					La fuerza capaz de frustrar el desafio de las fuerzas anti-reunificacion es la unidad de las fuerzas patrioticas pro-reunificacion.
					
					La unidad es el factor clave que decide el exito o la derrota del movimiento por la reunificacion de la patria. Esta verdad fue comprobada en la historia de ese movimiento de mas de 60 anos.
